content: Not as good as great little warm game 2. Too much BS going on in this version. Controls not as easy to use. They should have kept the format as v2 but added new maps and online play. Need to go back to the drawing board on this game. Hard to tell between different tanks and helicopters. Maps to big to fit on screen so hard to see what all is going on. Have to move view around too much. Just not fun to play at all. Should have stuck to old format.

Extremely difficult to understand compared to far more high quality TB games. More like a dice roller than a strategy game but still well worth the asking price if you enjoy turn based games this lacks nothing except a learning curve.

I wish this game was better because it has some good ideas to add to the series, but unfortunately it just doesn't measure up to the three games before it. This game isn't very much without online matches, and that's pretty much dead. You have botmatches on random maps and that can be fun, but the balance just isn't quite there for the new base system and neither is the AI. It feels like this game could use more depth, like a better terrain system.
Great game at first. Bht as the game.progresses, you'll see how stacked the other side is. They get grenades, dudes with laser guns, and rocket launchers. The grenades are not available for us peons.

seems like an awesome game, lots of units and possibilities for strategic games. it comes pretty close to advance wars and I'm thrilled. I'm especially interested in online games with friends, and one thing that bothers me is: if one of us misses the 24h turn limit, the game kicks that player. why is there even a time limit? when i start a match with a friend i want to finish with said friend, i don't care if there's a week long break in between. and we need push notifications. otherwise fun!
Fun

The app I spend most of my time on. Whilst I'd wish for a couple of extra features (listed at end) the game itself is A+++. Feature Wish List: - Push notification option advising it's your turn. - Tap n hold, for players ranking. - When opponent quits or times out, ability to still scroll through map to have better idea of the game you just won. - Pointer to a FAQ where you have general info on clans abilities AND scoring formula. - Entire match replay (a big request I know).
Too much tapping required to play this. Not user friendly at all. Uninstalled.

Great game, 1 small issue. Level 11" Mountains" the enemy is way too overpowered. After 78 in game days of playing that level, I haven't made a scratch on the enemy HQ. It seems like the enemy has infinate money on that level. Constantly building turrets that I must say are overpowered by themselves, let alone the constant bombing and attacking from "Behemoths". It would be great if you lowered the enemy's starting money, or make so the enemy doesn't start with turrets everywhere. Good game tho.
Good until The Mountains. This game is extremely frustrating. It was okay until getting to the mentioned level, then it just became absolutely frustrating and unplayable.

I was a little wary at first because of the price but SOOOOOOO WORTH IT!!! If you've been a fan of their previous games you are going to love this one! It's a lot more strategic and the amount of options you have to accomplish the mission is astronomical. 10/10 would recommend.

Online is up and working again. You can still also play solo campaigns and skirmishes against AI.The gameplay appears the same the last few years, but it is still a very good game that is never boring. Such a shame, it was a great game and hackers wrecked it. There are lots of options within the game to play against AI as you can set number of opponents and the strength of opponents. Basically, the game is in sleeping hiatus mode. It had such great prospects and hasn't reached full potential.

Great potential,needs work. Mostly related to the online. There should be time options per turn when playing online similar to most chess apps. Currently at 24 hours which is rediculous as you can take months for a single game. There should also be the option to review past games or even share them to study or brag about strategic victories. In the older games theres was fog of war which was removed. There should be the option for this. Should be able to see opponents rating. Much to fix

To be blunt this is a fantastic game but I was underwhelmed at the shortness of the ccompaign at online 22 missions (and a lot of those brief training ones). They do have a map generator and lots of skirmish maps but things are missing. Ie, we should be able to have the ability to customize the opponent more. Skirmishes ar generic and despite map changes are basically repetitive. Some items (like rocker artillery, epic tanks) are only available to the opponent, and not yourself. So lots of room for improvements for a round 2 of development.

Kind of a bummer compared to the others in the series. On its own, it's a decent game, but much of the strategy has been stripped away when compared to the legacy series. 10 of the 22 levels can still be considered 'tutorial' mode, some have been very small and unfulfilling. You no longer have to worry about fuel, ammunition or capturing enemy buildings. It seems the main way to play is just a throw resources at the enemy and destroy the their impoundments as much as possible. Getting your guys killed used to mean you made a tactical mistake, but now it almost seems part of the game.. to me that's just way less fun. Overpriced at $6

Great Turn based strategy game, no add-on purchases sucks as there is no way to get some of the units enemy gets such as double tank.

This is a GREAT strategy game. I liked the other versions which incrementally improved the game play, but Epic is the best. The AI is not the cleverest but the harder the level you choose, the more money your opponents are funded. There are multiple armies to choose from, each with various strengths and weaknesses. In skirmishes you can select any army you want to play for increased variability. You can set difficulty level. You can select various starting positions on maps. By changing the "side" option (1-6), you can set a free for all (all armies opposed each other), or you can set teams, or you can set them all against you. The map generator is another great feature to extend future playability. Once you tire of the pre-made maps, use the random generator. Get tired of that, select the map name window and type a name. Your pet, spouse, actor, state, phone number, etc. This is hands down my favorite game.
Like many people I have been waiting for this game to come out  but it just wasn't the same. I also liked it when you could capture bases

Too much "one shot one kill"; characters can rarely withstand a single hit from the other side.  No way to upgrade characters for better attack nor defense. No engineers to take over buildings. It's nothing like the other LWG.
Great
Great game, keep them coming!
These are the best games in the world by far. I have tried every other type of game and given up. Now I just play these...again and again. Keep making them and I will definitely buy them.
replyContent: Glad you like. Any chance your star rating can be made to match your satisfaction level?  :)

content: Like the previous war games, outstanding. I really like the building mechanic and the different factions was a great idea. Campaign is fun, so many skirmish maps and I love the random map feature. Really great job.

I've played all of the war game series. For me, this is by far the best. One of the aspects that keeps me coming back is the skirmish mode. Once you've completed the campaign the real replay value comes in the many skirmish maps available. All of which have a random mode effectively offering a different experience each time. Although the campaign is shorter than Great Big War Game I feel it's still well worth the small amount I paid. This game gets played more than any other on my tablet. If you love classic simple strategy games then the few bucks it costs will be well worth it. Give it a try.
Love it!!!!

Relatively short campaign compared to GBWG (only 22 missions), but I liked the game play better. I enjoyed leveling up the individual weapons in GBWG, but that is not an option in this one (only reason for 4 star). I would also like to play as some of the enemy's weapons (electric, epic tank, double tank, etc), but that is not available either. I haven't tried skirmish or online yet, I will update afterwards. If you liked the others in the series, you will like this one as well.
Great game
Games crash regularly on updated platforms and no direct ability to contact support. They are great when they work but crash all of the time.

I am a fan of the little war games by Rubicon, and was excited to see a new game. However on playing the game I found the graphics too busy and the whole feel of the game seems to have taken a step back. I much preferred the previous versions that had a clearer and cleaner feel.
I love it
Can't wait for new content, excited to see any new factions, what a great way to bring this game back!

Random maps!  This is the best of the series.  Some new units. Factions. It is the"little" version so no fog of war or ammo and fuel limits.  A ton of maps included but the random maps means unlimited play.  The maps use an alpha code if you want to share or replay.

This is a solid turn-based wargame. I've owned the other 2 and this one takes the series up several notches. Huge maps, a map generator and the ability to play more than 1 vs 1. I've always given Rubicon extra credit for releasing games with the 'one time buy, you get everything' pricing model, something that you just don't see these days. At $0.99, this game is a bargain with high replay-ability. Touch controls are a little non responsive on my Galaxy S8, I typically have to touch objects several times on occasion to select them, but other than that this is a great game.
Awesome addition to the series
Game wasn't what I thought. I played maybe 10 minutes and can't get a refund.

Would love to rate this game as i loved the previous ones. Unfortunatly after paying for it i cannot play it as it is flagging as unlicenced and wants me to pay again. Waiting for rubicon to solve this. VERY dissapointed.joeybear
Have bought and loved all of earlier games. But the version does not work on Google pixel c tablet. Even oreo upgrade made no difference. Game freezes after a couple of minutes. It used to work fine!
The best in the series so far. The addition of factions and unique units adds to the replayability.

Hands down Best phone game out there, wish there were some dlc, need an excuse to throw some money towards the games developers for it being so good, would have spent a hell of a load more than 89p amazing game, not sure what to add but another faction a few mor troops some customisation or whatever, bit I'd love to see some more things to spend my money on

Game have potentiel. But whitout zone of control (the ability to block mobility of enemy troop around your unit), considering the fact that troop can engage in battle the same turn that they are produce and that most unit have too much range : the game lose a lot in the strategie department.  The game would be better if most unit had 1-1 range (and that the price of unit with more range was ajusted in conequence), some with 1-2 and a few with more (sniper and artilery?). Also, the fact that unit can attact the same turn they are produce penalize agressive game play and make the game unpredictiable when in range of production (strategie is all about planning). Finally, with no zone of control the position of your troop mather a lot less and make the game less interesting.  As the game is now... I just produce unit that counter the ennemie one and win... and I dont feel that what I do mather... not much fun in that.

A pretty good little war game. Interesting new factions for pvp. The maps look and play wonderfully. Random map generator having a nearly limitless amount of random maps (wish there were a few basic parameters we could enter though). All in all, it's about the best TBS game I've found on mobile. But there are glaring balance issues with units and factions that ultimately made me lose interest in playing. I also think fog of war is critical for games like this. Otherwise, it's just whoever can make the most units the fastest.

Epic little war game should be called easy little war game... I'm slightly disappointed with this game the campaign is way too short and the online side of the game doesn't come close to making up for it. Are the devs planning on adding some more missions? Or even adding harder difficulty levels?
BRING BACK PORTRAIT MODE PLEASE!
Interesting new version, great campaign and endless maps to enjoy. Would like to see the opponents Health Bar a different colour from mine, would help on a small screen. Galaxy s6 on android 7.
Crashes. All the time.. I want a refund!!

Update: Rubicon, what's going on here, just played a 2v2 co-op with my friend and once of the enemies built 58 battle tanks in one round. There is no way they had that much coin saved up. Currently I have to text message my friend that it is his turn over a cell phone for him to know when it's his turn.

Great game, let down by no turn notifications on multiplayer. If you buy this to play against real people, you need to manually check your turns.
The previous games were the most played games on my devices! This is the BEST of the series IMO.  So far, loving it! The gameplay is emersive and fun. Great job once again Rubicon!

I've been a fan of the series since "Great little war game".  This game is fun, but as others have pointed out, the campaign is pretty short (22 levels). Moreover, the game lacks "fog of war" (having enemy troop movements hidden in areas without your troops present), and the AI is borderline retarded. All of these factors make the campaign mode far too easy to be satisfying. The skirmish mode is more challenging, so that may add some replay value.

Like a lot of others here, I've played the previous versions and loved them. Maybe things have just moved on since then but I found this game really boring compared to many other games I've played in the proceeding years since the last version.
I paid $1 50 for this game and it won't work because it says it is not licensed when it is by Google Play so either fix it or give me a refund and maybe then I'll bloody review it 0/10 don't get it

Poor game. In some battles you need heavy artillery and multiple attacks to take down a building wheras in others it takes a single shot from a sniper. No game help or resources whatsoever and it takes hours to figure out what units are actually good for.
It is a very exciting game. My favorite part was the Epic Tank in the iron fist faction.
Custom map making and custom missions

I absolutely loved Great Little War Game, but I feel this one is a step back, overall. Granted, there are new factions and some limited base building, but the campaign is much shorter, missions are pretty much the same, the AI is incredibly dim-witted (!!!),  and, worst of all, NO FOG OF WAR, taming whatever excitement the dumb AI could provide out of the game. As a consequence, the missions are way, way too easy and pose no challenge whatsoever. I'm glad I bought this on sale for $1, but I'd be more than happy to pay the full price if the AI and FoW were fixed. Maybe next time..
Great!

I like the series, but this game has the same flaw as the earlier ones: it's just too simple; the opponents are too stupid (and not in a funny way). I can live with all of it's flaws and bugs, but please improve the AI.
Great game, alot like advance wars
Classic rubicon. Great game and so glad I bought it at sale price, not a fiver which I think might be a little too much for only 22 levels.
It is coming up with a message saying that I haven't paid for it even though I have so I can't play the game
Only bought to support the developer because he stuck up for himself when confronted with rude customer in these reviews.

I've been looking for a solid TBS title via mobile for a while now and here it is, what an absolute joy to play. Arguably the closest thing to Command & Conquer that I've found, though C&C is an RTS and this is TBS.   There's a decent variety of units to choose from, a decent length campaign & great amount of replayability here.  My only gripe is most units don't look particularly different outside of weaponry, bit boring to look at. With the quirky and silly humour I expected more over the top aesthetics for some units. Hopefully some touch ups are done in the future or more units possibly added.  All in all however, great game. Worth the price of entry due to replayability and the overall quality of the title. Multiplayer too. Can't go wrong. Nice job guys.
Nice little game. Random maps are a nice feature. Plenty of units and buildings and strategies. Think of it as turn based SC

I got this for Nexus 5X and found it tedious on such a small screen. So I got it for iPad and ... still found it tedious. I really, really wanted to love it (been searching for a good mobile turn-based strategy for ages) but the gameplay is sluggish and individual decisions don't feel important. It's just: amass units and bash them into each other until a victor ever-so-slowly emerges. Still, kudos to the devs for doing something like this and skipping the crappy pay-to-win model. I don't love the game, but I'm glad they got some of my money for it.
The graphics are kinda bad so can you chage a litle
So good!

There are already new units with factions to change up the combat and more will be coming. Unless bad reviews kill the game off and then there'll be nowt tbh.

Not as good as the others, still good
Love this game, and love the others in the series. However, the campaign could be longer
Excellent approachable turn-based strategy game. Simple enough to learn pretty quickly, but with enough complexity and several factions that it has good replayability.

Played all the previous war games and loved them. Waited years for more content. Assumed the franchise was dead. Then to my surprise this new installment came out. I was in heaven. Then the honeymoon was over. I didnt agree with all the changes, however would still play again. The part im really disappointed about is the lack of content. I waited years for something, they charged full price for this ($6), yet there was only 22 campaign missions. Previous games had 50. I feel jipped in that regard.
replyContent: It's the not number, it's the quality? Sorry you wanted more, but options are limited when all teams can make their own bases. We didn't want to just rehash stuff to make the number go up as skirmish mode plays the same.

content: Amazingly fun tactical game!

If you like the other little war games, you'll love this one.  however the game needs a few tweaks to make it perfect. can play upto 6player in one map on skirmish but only 2player online? more factions needed, wheres the power up gone? its frustrating that you cant rotate what you build, cant back out of current game, campaign is too short, also when you are playing multiplayer online, the team colour is not the same, (eg. im blue team, but on my mates device, hes blue team)
I love this series of games from Rubicon. This game brings a whole different style of combat with new maps and units and it deserves nothing less than 5 stars

I really hope rubicon can come out with another game but i doubt it just because they took so long on releasing this one. If so, Hopefully more difficult and a longer lasting campaign mode
replyContent: The later campaign missions are like skirmish games so there's not much point in just calling a skirmish game mission 23, mission 24, etc. You can play skirmish how you like with any amount of enemies to suit your ability

content: I've purchased every one in this series and it's still my favorite casual mobile game. It's reminiscent of Advance Wars for game boy. The missions are just challenging enough to not be frustrating.
Finally it's here. Best strategy game. Everything I hoped for and more.

I agree with a previous commenter. ELWG is a bit rougher around the edges compared to previous games in the series. AI is far less intelligent, maps are not nearly as detailed or thought out, land air and sea units unbalanced, and not nearly as lengthy a campaign. I would spend money on extension packs as a way to help you make more money, but the gameplay has to get better. Overall a nice game, but not an improvement compared to your previous games.

Like many fans of the previous games I have waited a long time for this game. All you need to know is it doesn't disappoint! If you liked the others in the series buy it. If you like turn based games buy it. If you liked advance wars on the GBA then buy it. This developer deserves your money for their hard work creating this.

Update: an app update removed all my active online games. I was 15-20 moves deep into several matches. AAARGH!   A new edition of the little war game. Feels like a rewrite using new UI. Not a good as the old one. Graphics too much, hard to see or pick units sometimes. Worst, the AI seems to have taken a big big step back.

I'm just glad that this game finally exists!  After 3 years of playing "Great Big War Game," I'm more than ready to mix it up.  This has separate factions that actually have different abilities (not just different graphics like so many other games).  The ability to generate new maps with Minecraft-like seeds means we'll have plenty of variety, and I'm glad we can finally build our own structures.  The single-player campaign is fun enough, but multiplayer is where this game shines!  And just in time for summer!
Jebus, this is a great game! I haven't even delved into the multiplayer - they're missing a buddy list system but I hope I can find out how to initiate a game with someone specific soon...
I have waited more than a year for this game to come out. :')

I'm 2 weeks in and have only worked and completed the single player campaign. For $5.99 this is a steal. I've played my share of freemium games and I have invested $100's into developers thinking I was supporting them, only to watch the same old freemium game model  nerf , buff cycle Pay to Play / pay to win model. IMHO The campaign missions are worth $5.99..   Negatives. The game is incredibly tedious and the playing field gets crowded to the point you can't tell what is what anymore. Some of these missions take hours to complete as well.    Looking forward to the next phase online skirmishes. Although if matches take this long I don't see myself playing many online.  The game is worthy of your money. Especially if you've invested into freemium games.. this one will give you a satisfying experience for a helluva lot less coin.

Bit disappointed to be honest. I've been eagerly awaiting this for ages as I've loved all previous versions. Virtually unplayable  on my preferred Samsung SM-T210 and difficult on my Huawei phone. I feel that the new features (power plants etc . ) over complicate the game? Will keep on going as concept is still great but I might have to revert back to GBWG for rhe the umpteenth time,
Amazing game. There multiplayer has some kinks to work out, and it's the first game that doesn't give me enough notifications! I'd love a notification when it's my turn in multiplayer.
best game in years tired of those "Freemium" games

I liked this game very much (5 stars), but would have appreciated if- (1) had an option to select difficulty level, (2) if game progress could be recovered regardless of re-installing the game (if un-installed), as the completed missions take too long to finish again...  Apart from this, the gameplay features are phenomenal... Thanks
Update..can play w friends but friends list is coming soon
I've been really enjoying this new version. Great job guys, thanks a lot.

Epic indeed! This is the culmination of an outstanding series of turn based strategy games. This one adds many new features including new bases and units, better AI, multiple opponents, and infinite maps via the excellent map randomizer feature for endless fun.  What a great game!!!
Same great gameplay as the previous war games, with new mechanics like power generators.  Another hit from the dev.
Always great these Rubicon games :)
Awesome, keep up the great work
I've been a fan ever since the first iteration of war games.  Rubicon does not disappoint.  Great job guys!
Brilliant game! Amazing team making great games. Thank you guys so much!
Keeps crashing on Samsung S8+ since the new update. Crashes after 5mins when retracting a move... Loved it before but unplayable now...
replyContent: Sorry, that's something we broke fresh on friday. For now turn on the bottom option about minihud in the settings. A fix is coming later today

content: Please add immersive mode...
Great gameplay but it crash on my nexus 6p every 20 minutes. Hope you can fix it.

Brilliant just brilliant.  The next chapter of the war game series is a smashing success.  The folks at Rubicon have done it again, same classic game packed into a shinny new look with lots of new features, factions and units.  A shout out to all you Devs for this amazing game. :)
About time, what took you so long?! Awesome war games are back again, whooooop!
Great game!!!
Straight away purchase after finding it's finally out.just as good as the others
Instabuy! This series is best in class!

Such a great game. Many turn based strategy games are just too complicated or dry, but this series is the first to command my attention since Advance Wars. It's humour is infectious, graphics are bright and cheerful and the difficulty has a perfect upward curve. Before you know it you're actually enjoying a turn-based strategy game. And thank goodness you can actually buy it instead of dealing with 'free to play' mediocrity. This is how games should be.

A fantastic game! I have waited for a long time for this one!  I have an RCA Galileo tablet and the text gets run together and does not look right. I am relatively certain that this is a screen resolution issue.  From what I can find, the resolution is 1024x600, which is not the best, I know. Do you think that this could be fixed in an upcoming release?  Thanks!
replyContent: Thank you. We have a maintenance patch coming soon and this will be fixed in it.

content: Epic!
Another amazing game from these devs.  This is by far the best turn based strategy on android. Worth every penny!
This really is Epic. A great addition to the series. Looks great and is going to keep me busy for days! Excellent work!
